item.title: Linux File Systems
item.description: Directory Structure The directories help us to store the files and locate them when we need them. Also, directories are called folders as they can be assumed of as folders where files reside in the form of a physical desktop analogy. Directories can be organized in a tree-like hierarchy in Linux and several other operating systems. The directory structure of Linux is well-documented and defined in the Linux FHS (Filesystem Hierarchy Standard).

item.title: Expanding Rods(LightOj-1137)
item.description: Problem statement Here we are given a solid rod of length L that expands to length L’ and creates an arch shape with the original shape of the rod. Our task is to compute the distance by which the center of the rod is displaced. The problem could be easily visualized with the given picture in the problem statement. Let’s assume the straight rod AB is placed inside a circle and the arch shaped rod AB arch is on the perimeter of this circle.

item.title: Introduction
item.description: Greeting! This is an introduction post. This post tests the followings: Hero image is in the same directory as the post. This post should be at top of the sidebar. Post author should be the same as specified in author.yaml file.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: This sample post tests the followings: Category, sub-category nesting in the sidebar. Hero image and other images are in images folder inside this post directory.
